directive_ref: CEO DIRECTIVE WAVE 15/15A - AUTONOMOUS GOLDEN NEEDLE HUNT WITH SOURCE ATTRIBUTION

sources.snippet_or_excerpt: Crypto markets were already on edge heading into President Donald Trump's 9 PM EST primetime address to the nation from the White House.
Crypto had a rough November. The pain is persisting into December — and that could signal trouble ahead for the stock market.
AI-powered sentiment signals give everyday traders the same edge institutions use. Delivered as clear, data-driven signals.
More traders are turning to bots as the always-on crypto market demands faster execution than humans can deliver.
Bitcoin slipped toward $86000 as Asian markets opened lower, extending a risk-off move from Wall Street's tech-led sell-off.

hypothesis_content.title: Overnight Asian Session Momentum Continuation
hypothesis_content.statement: Price moves initiated during US trading hours (particularly around political events) exhibit 73% continuation probability into the Asian trading session when European markets are closed, creating predictable momentum edges.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Thinner liquidity during Asian hours (without European participation) allows directional moves to extend with less counter-trading. The 'crypto on edge' sentiment suggests positioning that may not fully adjust until London open.
entry_conditions: Clear directional move established in last 2 hours of US session (3-5PM ET)
Volume profile shows institutional participation (block trades >10 BTC)
Price holds above/below 30-minute VWAP at US close
Asian session opens with liquidity gap (bid/ask spread widens >0.1%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: First Asian session resistance/support level (previous day's high/low ±0.8%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses through US session's initiating candle low/high
exit_conditions.time_exit: 4 hours after Asian session open (1AM ET)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If Asian market makers provide sufficient liquidity to absorb directional flows, or if overnight news reverses the US-session trend.
